messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: SEATTLE POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION SECTION
Auto Theft Division
SIGNAL: 43A
ITEM NUMBER: A-43098-18
PAGE 11 of 45
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Rebecca Morris
Sgt. David Allen
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Eric Thompson
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Mark Lewis
Sgt. Julia Hernandez
( Traffic Enforcement Unit)
Det. Brian O'Connor
Det. Sarah Parker
( Traffic Enforcement Unit)
Det. Gary Wilson
( Traffic Enforcement Unit)
Det. Karen Young
Det. Michael Roberts
(General Assignment)
Det. Lisa Nguyen
(Property Crimes Section)
Det. Adam Carter
(Vehicle Identification Section)
VICTIM:
JOHN SMITH, male, date of birth 02/14/1970.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
09 JUNE 2018 at approximately 8:45 PM in the Capitol Hill area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Eric Thompson
3486
The case was marked by a series of intricate auto thefts and elusive suspects. Officer Johnson, patrolling Capitol Hill, was the first to notice the stolen vehicle. He, along with Sgt. Mark Lewis and Patrol Officer Green, coordinated the initial response. Technician Wallace, an expert in vehicular forensics, was assigned to examine the recovered vehicle. Criminalist Martinez, analyzing the evidence, found fingerprints and DNA that eventually led to a breakthrough in the case. Coroner Dr. Foster was called in to investigate a body discovered in a nearby park, initially overlooked but later connected to the auto theft ring. Patrol Officer Bailey, communicating with the local garage owners, gathered leads that significantly advanced the investigation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Rebecca Morris Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Auto Theft Division. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. David Allen Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Morris. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Eric Thompson Officer Context: Lead investigator for the auto theft case, also the reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Mark Lewis Officer Context: Assisted in the response, part of the Traffic Enforcement Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Julia Hernandez Officer Context: Traffic Enforcement Unit sergeant, supported the investigation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Brian O'Connor Officer Context: Traffic Enforcement Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Sarah Parker Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Traffic Enforcement Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Gary Wilson Officer Context: Traffic Enforcement Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Karen Young Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Michael Roberts Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the auto theft case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Lisa Nguyen Officer Context: Property Crimes Section detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Adam Carter Officer Context: Vehicle Identification Section detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Johnson Officer Context: First to notice the stolen vehicle in Capitol Hill. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Green Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating the initial response to the stolen vehicle. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Wallace Officer Context: Specialized in vehicular forensics, examined the recovered vehicle. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Martinez Officer Context: Analyzed evidence, found fingerprints and DNA linked to suspects. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Foster Officer Context: Investigated a body discovered in a nearby park, linked it to the auto theft ring. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Bailey Officer Context: Communicated with local garage owners, gathered leads for the case. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
